lessons.instructions: Repeat each sentence immediately after hearing it, matching pronunciation and rhythm.

content.danish: Jeg har det godt, tak. Hvad med dig?
content.english: I’m good, thank you. And you?

content.danish: Jeg hedder Peter. Hvad hedder du?
content.english: My name is Peter. What’s your name?

lessons.instructions: Listen to the conversation between two native speakers and try to understand the general meaning.

conversation.speaker: A
conversation.english: Excuse me, where is the supermarket?

conversation.speaker: B
conversation.danish: Det ligger til venstre for posthuset.
conversation.english: It’s to the left of the post office.

lessons.instructions: You will play one speaker, and the narrator will play the other. Respond in Danish where prompted.

content.learner_prompt: Respond with what you’d like to drink.

content.narrator: Vil du have noget at spise?
content.learner_prompt: Respond with what you’d like to eat.

lessons.instructions: Learn these useful chunks of language as complete phrases.

content.danish: Jeg vil gerne bestille en kop kaffe.
content.english: I would like to order a cup of coffee.
Where is the nearest train station?
Can I get the bill, please?

lessons.instructions: Listen to the short story, then answer the questions in Danish.

content.story: Mette går på arbejde hver morgen klokken otte. Hun tager bussen og køber en kop kaffe på vej. I dag købte hun også en sandwich.

questions.danish: Hvad tid går Mette på arbejde?
questions.english: What time does Mette go to work?

lessons.instructions: Listen to the sentence and identify the error. Then, correct it in Danish.

content.error: Jeg går til butikken i går.
content.correct: Jeg gik til butikken i går.
content.english: I went to the store yesterday.

lessons.instructions: Imagine you’re in a situation. Respond to the narrator in Danish.

content.narrator: Kan jeg hjælpe dig med noget?
content.learner_prompt: Ask for the nearest bus stop.
